definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: signet, signet-ring, ring (on format. v. Lag:BN 88; As. ṭimbu’u, seal-ring, Muss-Arnolt:l. c.)—abs. [[טַבַּעַת]] Ex 26:24 + 3 t.; cstr. id. Es 3:12 + 3 t.; [[טַבַּעְתּוֹ]] Ge 41:42 + 2 t.; pl. abs. [[טַבָּעוֹת]] Is 3:1, Ex 28:23; [[טַבָּעׂת]] Ex 25:12, Ex 25:12 + 14 t. cstr. [[טַבְּעוֹת]] Ex 28:23 + 2 t.; [[טַבְּעׂת]] Ex 25:12 + 12 t.; sf. [[טַבְּעׂתָ֠ו]] Ex 28:28, Ex 39:21; [[טַבְּעׂתֵיהֶם]] Ex 26:29; [[טַבְּעׂתָם]] Ex 36:34; —

definitions.title: l.
definitions.body: signet-ring, of king, taken from his hand and given as token of authority Ge 41:42 (E), Es 3:10, Es 8:2; used in sealing official missives Es 3:12, Es 8:8, Es 8:8, Es 8:10 (vb. [[חָתַם]]).
ring, as ornament Is 3:21; as gift for sacred purposed Ex 35:22, Nu 31:50 (both P).
most often (only in Ex.) of rings for staves of ark, for curtains, for ephod, and other sacred furniture Ex 25:12, Ex 25:12, Ex 25:12 + 35 t. in Ex (all P).
